definition: branch of study/administrative section/division/field/branch/stage directions/family (taxonomy)/rules/laws/to mete out (punishment)/to levy (taxes etc)/to fine sb/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: He teaches all liberal sciences and gives account of dead souls that died in sin.

sentences.english: In addition, with Gio arts Chiellini may not be able to play.

sentences.english: Sometimes a liberal arts degree will suffice.

sentences.english: They come from the arts and a humanitarian educational background.

sentences.english: She spent three years at the liberal arts college, scraping along on an allowance from her parents.

sentences.english: The humanities continue to thrive in elite liberal arts schools.

sentences.english: Such a foundation course is central to the humanities in Europe (Geistesgeschichte, histoire des idées).

sentences.chinese: Saks在牛津大学获得了文科硕士学位。

sentences.english: Yale is comprised of the College, the Graduate School of Arts and Sciences, and 13 professional schools.
sentences.chinese: 耶鲁由人文科学研究院和其他13个职业院系组成。

sentences.english: Indeed, novas and so on Qiao liberal arts are especially the article arrogant capital.

sentences.english: All the time the subject is troubling the students.

sentences.english: At my school the students of Arts have been using the edition A.
sentences.chinese: 很多高中文科学生一直使用人教版A教材。
